text.0: we through the master of the field even as through a friend obtain.
text.1: what nourisheth our kine and steeds in such may he be good to us.
text.2: as the cow yieldeth milk pour for us freely lord of the field the wave that beareth sweetness.
text.3: distilling meath wellpurified like butter and let the lords of holy law be gracious.
text.4: sweet be the plants for us the heavens the waters and full of sweets for us be airs midregion.
text.5: may the fields lord for us be full of sweetness and may we follow after him uninjured.
text.6: happily work our steers and men may the plough furrow happily.
text.7: happily be the traces bound happily may he ply the goad.
text.8: Śuna and sīra welcome ye this laud and with the milk which ye have made in heaven.
text.9: bedew ye both this earth of ours.
text.10: auspicious sītā come thou near we venerate and worship thee.
text.11: that thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly.
text.12: may indra press the furrow down may pūṣan guide its course aright.
text.13: may she as rich in milk be drained for us through each succeeding year.
text.14: happily let the shares turn up the ploughland happily go the ploughers with the oxen.
text.15: with meath and milk parjanya make us happy grant us prosperity Śuna and sīra.
